result.execSummary:
The defendant Dijon P. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously proved).
** Pay DNA surcharge.  May Not have contact with co deft's, Marshawn (unknown last name), Thoams E, Victim unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH. Huber allowed.  Can be released to go to school when school starts.  Credit for 19 days.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: For Ct 2 only - Dismissed and read in.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions, concurrent to 15CM370, 14CF1307, 14CF1308; 60 days conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 19 days served; deft may be released to go to school when it starts; deft taken into custody from court; submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be applied to costs in 15CM370 and any remainder thereafter returned to poster.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

149 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco Defilippis.  Clk  LE.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court. Defendant requests Jury Trial. DA Pretrial set for 7/10/15 @ 140 p.m. &  Judicial Pretrial set for 8/12/15 @ 115 p.m. with other case 15-CM-370.  $500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
and witness list filed by the State
